item.description: US-91 North at Oxford Highway in Bannock County. The intersection is located at Red Rock Pass which was the site of an ancient dam on prehistoric Lake Bonneville. item.description: ID-46 North in Gooding County. This is the first ID-46 shield northbound, about 10 miles north of its beginning in Buhl. The section between Wendell and Buhl was added to the state highway system in the last 5 years.

item.description: ID-8 west along the Pullman Highway in Moscow.

item.description: End ID-69 approaching I-84 in Meridian.

item.description: US-95 south approaching US-12. Use right lane for US-12 west to Lewiston; left lane for US-95 South/US-12 East to Boise.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-1 north. Distance to Porthill. Porthill is located on the Canadian border.

item.description: Distance marker on US-95 north. Distance to Jct. SH-1, Creston (BC via ID-1), and Cranbrook (BC via US-95).

item.description: Distance marker on US-95 North/US-2 East. Distance to Junction US-2, Moyie Springs (via US-2), and Canada (via US-95).

item.description: US-95 North/US-2 East at Bus. US-95 Jct. to (Bonners Ferry) City Center. Continue ahead for Moyie Springs (via US-2) and Canada (via US-95). The Kootenai River bridge is in the background of the photo.

item.description: US-95 North/US-2 East at Ash St. in Bonners Ferry

item.description: US-95 North/US-2 East at Alderson Ln. Turn right for Alderson Lake and Paradise Valley.

item.description: US-95 North approaching US-2 and ID-200 in Ponderay. US-2 east joins US-95 north to Bonners Ferry. This is also the western end of multi-state highway 200. Highway 200 starts here as ID-200, and crosses Montana, and North Dakota before ending in Minnesota. The ID-200 shield has an inverted color scheme.

item.description: Entering Ponderay on US-95 north.

item.description: US-95 North approaching south access to Sandpoint. Merge right for access to Sandpoint. This is the southern end of the Sandpoint bypass completed in 2012. Prior to the bypass, all US-95 traffic routed through downtown Sandpoint.

item.description: US-95 north approaching Exit 449 - ID-54/Athol/Bayview. Use Exit 449 for Farragut State Park.

item.description: US-95 north approaching Exit 446 - Brunner Road/Bunco Road. Use Exit 446 for Silverwood theme park.

item.description: US-95 north approaching Exit 442 - Chilco Road/Ohio Match Road. This is the beginning of new US-95 alignment north of Coeur d’Alene.

item.description: US-95 North at Northwest Blvd. West. Use Northwest Blvd. for Post Falls and for I-90 (West). Continue north on US-95 for Sandpoint, Canada and I-90 (East).

item.description: US-95 North at Northwest Blvd to Downtown Coeur d’Alene. Continue north on US-95 for Sandpoint.

item.description: US-95 North at ID-58 Junction. Use ID-58 for Spokane and CdA (Coeur d’Alene) Casino and Resort.

item.description: US-20/US-26 East/US-95 South at Roswell junction (Old Highway 18) in Parma.

item.description: End of ID-44 at I-84/US-30 junction to Caldwell and Boise.

item.description: Distance marker on US-30 east. Distance to Emmett (via ID-72), Caldwell, and Boise.

item.description: Distance marker on US-30 east. Distance to New Plymouth and Emmett.

item.description: I-184 East / I-84 West Separation. Use right lane for Franklin Road (Exit 1A) and left lane for I-184 East/City Center.

item.description: Overhead for I-84 West - Nampa/Ontario (Oregon) on I-84 just west of the I-84/I-184 junction.

item.description: I-84 west at Exit 49 - I-184/Franklin Road/City Center.

item.description: End ID-21 South at I-84 in Boise. Use right lanes for I-84 West; left lanes for I-84 East and for Gowen Road.

item.title: ID-21 West - Boise City Limit
item.description: Entering Boise on ID-21 west - Population 205, 671. Boise is the capital of Idaho and the largest city in Idaho.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West Front St. at 13th St.
item.description: US-20/US-26 West (Front St.) at 13th St. After 13th St. US-20/US-26 becomes a freeway, locally known as The Connector. Use the connector for Garden City, I-84, and I-184.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West (Broadway Ave.) at Front St.
item.description: US-20/US-26 West (Broadway Ave.) at Front St. Turn left on Front St. to continue west on US-20/US-26.

item.description: US-20/US-26 west (Broadway Ave.) approaching Front St. Use left lanes to continue west on US-20/US-26.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - Broadway Ave Approaching Front St
item.description: US-20/US-26 West (Broadway Ave.) approaching Front St. Use left lanes for Front St. These types of US shields are not at all common in Idaho. Almost all US shields are shown as solid white, not just white outlines. These signs appeared after the new bridge over the Boise River was completed here.

item.title: I-84 West Offramp at US-20/US-26 - Broadway Ave.
item.description: I-84 West Offramp at US-20/US-26 - Broadway Ave. Turn right on Broadway Ave. to continue west on US-20/US-26, Boise State University, Convention Center, and City Center. Turn left for Broadway Ave. south to Industrial Park. US-20/US-26 leaves I-84 westbound here, and rejoins I-84 in Caldwell.

item.title: I-84 West - Exits 53 and 54
item.description: I-84 west at Exit 54 - US-20/US-26/Broadway Ave. Approaching Exit 53 - Vista Ave./Boise Airport. US-20/US-26 leave I-84 here.

item.title: Begin ID-21 North at I-84
item.description: Begin ID-21 North at I-84. Use left lane for I-84 west; use right lane for Southbound Federal Way.

item.title: I-84 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on I-84 east. Distance to Mountain Home, Glenns Ferry, and Twin Falls.

item.title: Orchard St. South at I-84 East
item.description: Orchard St. South at I-84 East to Mountain Home and Twin Falls. Orchard St. continues south as Gowen Road.

item.title: Orchard St. South at I-84
item.description: Orchard St. South at I-84. Use I-84 west for Nampa and Caldwell; I-84 east for Twin Falls.

item.title: I-84 West Exit 211 Offramp at US-30/ID-24
item.description: I-84 west on Exit 211 offramp. Turn right for ID-24 west to Rupert; turn left for BL-84 West/US-30 West to Burley and Heyburn.

item.title: ID-87 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-87 north. Distance to Quake Lake, Ennis, and Helena. All three of these destinations are in Montana. ID-87 is a short state highway that follows the east shore of Henrys Lake, before climbing to the Continental Divide at Raynolds Pass on the Idaho-Montana line.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 113
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 113 - Exit 113. This is the only instance of an interchange in Idaho with simply the name of its exit. The advanced signage at this interchange is Shelley, and same as the southbound exit name. This sign has been in place since BL-15 and US-26 was routed to the newer Exit 116 interchange.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 113
item.description: I-15 north approaching Exit 113 - Shelley.

item.title: I-15 North - Idaho Falls Exits
item.description: Idaho Falls - Next 4 Exits on I-15 north. Idaho Falls is the 4th biggest city in Idaho behind Boise, Nampa, and Meridian and the biggest city outside of the Boise Metropolitan area.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 108
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 108 - Shelley - Firth Area.

item.title: End BL-15 North at I-15/US-26/ID-39 Junction
item.description: End BL-15 North at I-15/US-26/ID-39 Junction in Blackfoot. Turn right for I-15 North/US-26 East to Idaho Falls and Butte (Montana). Continue under freeway for I-15 south to Pocatello, and for US-26/ID-39 to Arco. This is the northern end of the Blackfoot business loop.

item.title: US-26 East at I-15 North and BL-15
item.description: US-26 East at I-15 North and BL-15 in Blackfoot. Use I-15 North/US-26 East to Idaho Falls and Butte (Montana). Continue straight for BL-15 to Blackfoot city center.

item.title: US-26 East at I-15 South
item.description: US-26 East at I-15 South in Blackfoot. Use I-15 south for Pocatello. Continue straight for Blackfoot and I-15 north to Idaho Falls.

item.title: End ID-39 North at US-26
item.description: End ID-39 North at US-26 in Blackfoot. Turn right for I-15 access.

item.title: End ID-39 North Approaching US-26
item.description: End ID-39 north approaching US-26 in Blackfoot. Turn left for US-26 west to Arco; turn right for US-26 east to Blackfoot and Idaho Falls.

item.title: BL-86 East (Idaho St.) at ID-39
item.description: BL-86 East (Idaho St.) at ID-39. Turn right to continue east on BL-86 East and for ID-39 south. Turn left for ID-39 north. American Falls Reservoir is in the background of the view.

item.title: BL-86 East (Idaho St.) at ID-39
item.description: BL-86 East (Idaho St.) at ID-39 in American Falls. Turn right for BL-86 East/ID-39 south to Pocatello. Turn left for ID-39 north to Aberdeen and Blackfoot.

item.title: BL-86 East (Fort Hall Ave.) at Idaho St.
item.description: BL-86 East (Fort Hall Ave.) at Idaho St. Turn left on Idaho St. to continue east on BL-86 to Pocatello, Blackfoot, and Aberdeen (via ID-39)

item.title: BL-86 East (Fort Hall Ave.) at Idaho St.
item.description: BL-86 East (Fort Hall Ave.) at Idaho St in American Falls. Turn left on Idaho St. to continue east on BL-86 and for ID-39 junction.

item.title: BL-86 East - Power County
item.description: BL-86 East (American Falls business loop) in Power County.

item.title: I-86 East - Freeway Entrance
item.description: Freeway Entrance on I-86 east. This style sign assembly for freeway entrances is not very common in Idaho. Also, note that the I-86 shield has the text IDAHO in it, which is also pretty rare. Most of the interstate shields that have the text IDAHO in them are older. This sign appears to be newer.

item.title: I-86 Exit 36 Offramp at BL-86/ID-37
item.description: I-86 Exit 36 offramp at BL-86/ID-37. Turn right on ID-37 south for Rockland. Turn left for BL-86 East to American Falls and Aberdeen (via ID-39). This is the west end of the American Falls business loop.

item.title: I-86 (Exit 21) Offramp at Coldwater Area
item.description: I-86/US-30 East (Exit 21) Offramp at Coldwater Area jct. Turn right for Coldwater Area and Frontage Road.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 216
item.description: I-84 east approaching Exit 216 - ID-25/ID-77/Declo/Albion.

item.title: BL-84 East (3rd St.) at ID-45
item.description: BL-84 East (3rd St.) at ID-45 in Nampa. Continue straight for ID-45 south to Murphy and Silver City. Turn left on 11th Ave. to continue east on BL-84 to Meridian and Boise.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 44
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 44 - ID-69 South/Meridian/Kuna. This interchange was rebuilt in 2015 as a SPUI. The ID-69 shield in attached to the exit sign incorrectly has the state of Idaho filled in all black. Normally on these types of state highway shields on freeway junctions, the state is shown white with a black outline and black text.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 38
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 38 - BL-84/Garrity Blvd/Idaho Center Blvd. Use I-84 east for Meridian and Boise. This is the eastern end of the Nampa/Caldwell business loop.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 38

Notice the US highway shields are missing the surrounding black box. This stretch of highway was recently widened, and it was probably incorrectly placed by a contractor.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-55 south. Distance to Horseshoe Bend and Boise.

item.description: End Banks-Lowman Highway at ID-55. Use ID-55 north for McCall; ID-55 south for Boise.

item.description: ID-21 South at Banks-Lowman Highway Jct. Use the Banks-Lowman Highway for Garden Valley and Banks.

item.description: Entering Lowman on ID-21 south.

item.description: Entering Avalanche Zone on ID-21 south. This area south of Banner Summit has frequent avalanches in the winter, which causes road closures.

item.description: Entering Boise County along ID-21 south. The Boise-Custer County Line is located on Banner Summit - Elevation 7037 Feet.

item.description: ID-21 North - Ponderosa Pine Scenic Byway. The Ponderosa Pine Scenic Byway runs along ID-21 between Boise and Stanley.

item.description: Truck restrictions on ID-21 between Lowman and Idaho City.

item.title: ID-75 North at ID-21 South
item.description: ID-75 North at ID-21 South. Use ID-75 north for Lower Stanley and Salmon. Use ID-21 south for Boise. The Salmon River can be seen in the background of the picture.

item.description: ID-21 Junction on ID-75 North in Stanley.

item.title: ID-75 North Approaching ID-21
item.description: Approaching ID-21 Junction on ID-75 North in Stanley. Milemarker 189.

item.description: ID-75 North at Redfish Lake Lodge/Visitor Center junction.

item.description: Entering the community of Obsidian on ID-75 north.

item.description: Entering Custer County on ID-75 north at the Salmon River.

item.title: ID-75 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-75 north. Distance to Stanley, Challis, and Salmon. Milemarker 129. The milemarkers on ID-75 continue reflect the distance from the Idaho-Nevada state line (via US-93) rather than the beginning of ID-75. Originally, ID-75 was signed as US-93.

item.title: ID-75 North at US-20
item.description: ID-75 north at US-20. Use US-20 east for Carey; US-20 west for Fairfield. Continue north to Sun Valley.

item.description: Entering Blaine County on ID-75 north.

item.title: ID-75 North - Magic Reservoir West Side
item.description: ID-75 North at junction to Magic Reservoir - West Side. Magic Reservoir lies on the Big Wood River south of Sun Valley.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-75 north. Distance to Bellevue, Hailey, and Sun Valley.

item.title: ID-75 North - Sawtooth Scenic Byway
item.description: ID-75 North - Sawtooth Scenic Byway. The Sawtooth Scenic Byway runs between Shoshone and Stanley along ID-75.

item.description: US-26/US-93 at ID-75 in Shoshone. Turn right for US-26 East/US-93 North to Arco and Idaho Falls. Continue straight for ID-75 to Sun Valley.

item.description: US-26 east at US-93 in downtown Shoshone. Turn right for US-93 south to Twin Falls; turn left for US-26 East/US-93 North to Idaho Falls (via US-20) and Sun Valley (via ID-75). US-26 joins US-93 northbound to Arco.

item.title: US-26 East at US-93
item.description: US-26 east at US-93 in downtown Shoshone. US-26 joins US-93 northbound to Arco.

item.title: ID-46 North at US-26
item.description: ID-46 north at US-26. Turn right on US-26 east for Shoshone; left on US-26 west for Bliss. Continue north on ID-46 for Fairfield.

item.description: ID-46 North approaching US-26 in Gooding.

item.title: ID-46 North - Entering Gooding
item.description: Entering Gooding on ID-46 north. Gooding is the county seat of Gooding County.

item.title: US-26 East - Entering Lincoln County
item.description: Entering Lincoln County on US-26 east.

item.title: I-84 - Exit 137 Offramp at Pioneer Road
item.description: I-84 - Exit 137 Offramp at Pioneer Road. Merge left for Pioneer Road. Continue straight for US-30 to Bliss and Buhl.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 137
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 137 - BL-84/US-30/Bliss/Buhl. US-30 leaves I-84 here, and rejoins I-84 in Heyburn. This is the western end of the Thousands Springs Scenic Byway.

item.title: I-84 East - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80/Truck Speed 70 on I-84 east. Idaho raised the speed limits on most rural interstates from 75 to 80 in July 2014.

item.title: End BL-84 East at I-84 (Exit 90)
item.description: End BL-84 east at I-84, Exit 90 onramps. Use I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 east for Twin Falls; use I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 west for Boise. This is the western end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.title: BL-84 West Approaching I-84
item.description: BL-84 west approaching I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 in Mountain Home. This is the western end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.title: BL-84 West/To I-84
item.description: BL-84 West/To I-84 on the west side of Mountain Home.

item.title: ID-51 North at BL-84
item.description: ID-51 North (Old US-30) at BL-84. Turn right on American Legion Blvd. for BL-84 east; continue straight for BL-84 west.

item.title: ID-51 North At Old US-30
item.description: ID-51 north at Old US-30. Use Old US-30 for I-84 eastbound access. Continue north on ID-51 for I-84, BL-84, Boise, Glenns Ferry, and Twin Falls. This intersection used to route Twin Falls traffic along Old US-30, but has recently been changed to route traffic along the business loop.

item.title: ID-51 North at ID-67
item.description: ID-51 north at ID-67. Turn left for ID-67 east to US Ecology Idaho Waste Site and Mountain Home AFB. Turn right on ID-51 north for Mountain Home and Boise.

item.description: ID-51 north approaching ID-67. Turn right to continue north on ID-51; left for ID-67.

item.description: Entering Elmore County on ID-51 north, on the bridge over the Snake River.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-51 north. Distance to Mountain Home and Boise.

item.title: ID-51 North/ID-78 East Jct.
item.description: ID-51 North/ID-78 East at ID-51/ID-78 junction. Turn right for ID-78 east to Hammett and Bruneau Dunes State Park. Continue north on ID-51 for Mountain Home and Boise.

item.title: ID-51 North/ID-78 East at Split
item.description: ID-51 North/ID-78 East at split. Merge right to continue east on ID-78.

item.title: ID-51 North/ID-78 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-51 North/ID-78 East. Distance to Mountain Home and Boise.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-51 North/ID-78 East. Distance to Bruneau, Mountain Home, and Boise.

item.title: I-84 East - Speed Limit 80
item.description: Speed Limit 80 MPH on I-84 east. Truck speed limit 70 MPH. The speed limit in Idaho was raised in July 2014. Utah, Texas, and Wyoming also have speed limits this high.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 3
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 3 - US-95/Payette/Parma. First Idaho exit.

item.title: I-84 East Approaching Exit 3
item.description: I-84 east approaching Exit 3. Use Exit 3 for Fruitland, New Plymouth, and Winnemucca (Nevada).

item.title: ID-78 West at ID-167 East
item.description: ID-78 west at ID-167 east in Grand View.

item.title: ID-78 West at Mud Flat Road
item.description: ID-78 west at Mud Flat Road to Mud Flat and Juniper Mountain. Continue west on ID-78 for Grand View. This is the beginning of the Owyhee Uplands Backcountry Byway, which follows Mud Flat Road along the south side of the Owyhee Mountains and ending in Jordan Valley, Oregon.

item.title: ID-51 North - Entering Grasmere
item.description: Entering Grasmere on ID-51 north. Grasmere is basically a ghost town. There are some broken down gas pumps and a few abandoned buildings.

item.title: ID-51 North - Leaving Duck Valley Indian Reservation
item.description: Leaving the Duck Valley Indian Reservation on ID-51 north.

item.title: ID-51 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-51 north. Distance to Riddle, Grasmere, and Mountain Home. This is the first shield and distance marker along ID-51 after the stateline.

item.description: US-93 south at ID-74. Turn left on ID-74 north for Twin Falls. Continue south on US-93 for Jackpot, NV and Wells, NV.

item.title: I-84 East at Exit 173 Offramp
item.description: I-84 east - Exit 173 offramp. Use right lane for US-93 south to Twin Falls and Wells, Nev. Use left lane for US-93 north to Sun Valley.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 173
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 173 - US-93/Twin Falls/Sun Valley. The exit text on this interchange changed in 2013 when the ramp was reconstructed. The former destination was for Twin Falls and Wells, Nev.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 95
item.description: I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 east at Exit 95 - US-20 East/To BL-84/Mountain Home/Fairfield. It is unclear why this sign lists I-84 with the text TO, because BL-84 joins I-84 at this interchange. US-20 leaves I-84 eastbound.

item.title: US-93 North at I-84 West
item.description: US-93 north at I-84 west to Jerome and Boise. Continue north on US-93 for Shoshone and Sun Valley.

item.title: US-93 North at I-84 East
item.description: US-93 north at I-84 east to Pocatello. Continue under overpass for I-84 west to Boise. Continue north on US-93 for Sun Valley.

item.title: US-93 North Approaching I-84
item.description: US-93 north approaching I-84. Use right lanes for I-84 west to Boise.

item.title: US-93 South at US-30 East
item.description: US-93 south at US-30 east to Twin Falls. Continue south on US-93 for Jackpot (NV) and Wells (NV). This sign is not typical in that the font is in all capital letters. Typically this sort of sign is not all upper case.

item.title: US-93 South at US-30
item.description: US-93 south at US-30 interchange. Turn right for US-30 west; continue under overpass for US-30 east.

item.title: US-93 South Approaching US-30 West
item.description: US-93 South approaching US-30 West. Use US-30 west for Filer.

item.description: US-93 south approaching 4100 N/Pole Line Road interchange. US-93 south leaves Pole Line Road at this interchange and swings south.

item.description: US-93 South (Blue Lakes Blvd.) at Bus. US-93. Turn right on Pole Line Road to continue south on US-93. Continue straight on Blue Lakes Blvd. for Bus. US-93. US-93 was recently re-routed through Twin Falls along a bypass. Bus. US-93 follows the old route through Twin Falls.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East Approaching I-84/US-30
item.description: US-20/US-26 east approaching I-84/US-30 onramp.

item.description: US-20/US-26 East/US-95 South in Parma

item.description: US-20/US-26 East/US-95 South at Roswell junction (Old Highway 18) in Parma.

item.description: End US-95 Spur north at US-95 in Weiser.

item.description: US-95 Spur north at Olds Ferry Jct. Turn right for Olds Ferry; continue north on US-95 Spur for Payette and Weiser. Entering Weiser, Idaho.

item.description: ID-55 South (Eagle Road) at US-20/US-26. Turn right for US-20/US-26 west to Caldwell; left for US-20/US-26 east to Boise; straight for ID-55 south to Meridian.

item.description: ID-44 west at ID-55. Turn right for ID-55 south; continue straight for ID-55 north/ID-44 east. ID-55 joins ID-44 through Eagle.

item.description: ID-44 east (State St.) at ID-55. Turn right on ID-55 (Eagle Road) for Meridian. Turn left on Eagle Road for Eagle (downtown). Continue straight on ID-44/ID-55 for Boise. ID-55 follows ID-44 through Eagle.

item.title: ID-44 East Approaching ID-55
item.description: ID-44 east approaching ID-55 in Eagle.

item.description: ID-44 east at ID-16 in Star.

item.description: ID-44 east approaching ID-16. Turn left on ID-16 north of Emmett and Firebird Raceway. Continue east on ID-44 for Eagle and Boise.

item.description: Entering Ada County on ID-44 east. Ada County is home to Boise, the capital of Idaho, and is the most populous county in the state.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-44 east. Distance to Star, Eagle, and Boise.

item.description: Distance marker on ID-44 east. Distance to Middleton, Star, and Boise.

item.description: I-84 East (Exit 25) at ID-44 junction. Turn left for ID-44 east to Middleton. Continue ahead for the onramp for I-84/US-30 towards Caldwell and Boise.

item.description: US-20/US-26 west (Broadway Ave.) approaching Front St. US-20/US-26 traffic turns left on Front St. Turn right at the next light for Park Blvd. to Park Center Blvd.

item.description: US-20/US-26 West (Broadway Ave.) approaching Front St. US-20/US-26 traffic need to get in the left lanes to turn onto Front St.

item.description: BL-84 east at I-84 west interchange (Exit 95) in Mountain Home. Turn left for I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 west towards Boise. Continue straight ahead for US-20 east to Fairfield. This is the eastern end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.title: BL-84 East at I-84/US-20
item.description: BL-84 east at I-84/US-30/US-20/US-26 jct. Turn right for I-84/US-26/US-30 east towards Twin Falls. Continue under overpass for I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 west towards Boise. Continue past intersection for US-20 east towards Fairfield. This is the east end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.title: BL-84 East Approaching I-84/US-20
item.description: BL-84 east approaching I-84/US-20 junction (Exit 95) in Mountain Home.

item.description: Distance marker on BL-84 east in Mountain Home. Distance to Hill City, Fairfield, and Sun Valley. All these cities are via US-20 east, which BL-84 turns into.

item.description: BL-84 east (American Legion Blvd.) in Mountain Home.

item.description: S 3rd St. (Old BL-84) at ID-51 (to BL-84). Turn left for ID-51 south to Mountain Home AFB and Bruneau. Turn right for ID-51 north (to BL-84) to Boise. BL-84 was formerly routed along S 3rd St. into Mountain Home.

item.description: Old US-30 at Old Oregon Trail Road. Turn left for I-84 (at Exit 99); turn right for Mountain Home. This is the old Mountain Home business loop.

item.description: BL-84 in Hammett. Turn right to continue west on BL-84 and for I-84.

item.description: BL-84 west at ID-78 in Hammett. Use ID-78 west for Bruneau; continue west on BL-84 to Mountain Home.

item.description: East Old Oregon Trail Highway at BL-84 (1st St) in Glenns Ferry. Turn right to take 1st St. into Glenns Ferry. The 1st St. is part of the Main Oregon Trail Back Country Byway.

item.description: Turn right on to continue on the Oregon Trail Back Country Byway and BL-84 (Railroad Ave) in Glenns Ferry.

item.description: BL-84 west (1st St.) at Railroad Ave. in Glenns Ferry. Turn right on Railroad Ave. to continue on west BL-84.

item.description: Speed limit 25 MPH on BL-84 west in Glenns Ferry.

item.description: Entering Glenns Ferry, Idaho on BL-84 west - Population 1,611.

item.description: Old US-30 at I-84 East/BL-84 junction. Turn left on I-84 east towards Bliss and Twin Falls. Continue straight for BL-84 into Glenns Ferry.

item.description: Old US-30 at I-84/BL-84 junction. Turn right on I-84 west towards Boise. Continue ahead for I-84/BL-84 towards Glenns Ferry and Twin Falls.

item.description: I-84 west Exit 129 offramp. Turn right for King Hill.

item.description: End ID-69 North at I-84/US-30/ID-55. Turn right for I-84/US-30 East/ID-55 north; continue over freeway for I-84/US-30 West/ID-55 South.

item.description: End ID-69 north at I-84/US-30/ID-55 junction. Turn right for I-84/US-30 East/ID-55 north towards Boise; continue over freeway for I-84/US-30 West/ID-55 South towards Nampa. Meridian Road continues north into Meridian.

item.title: End ID-69 North Approaching I-84
item.description: End ID-69 north approaching I-84 in Meridian.

item.title: ID-69 South at I-84 East
item.description: ID-69 south at I-84 east towards Boise. Continue south on ID-69 for Kuna.

item.description: I-84 east Exit 44 offramp at ID-69 junction. Turn left for ID-69 south to Kuna; turn right for Meridian Road to Meridian (City Center).

item.description: Meridian Exits on I-84 west: Eagle Road (ID-55), Meridian Road (ID-69), and Ten Mile Road.

item.description: Franklin Road at I-184 west. Use I-184 west To I-84, Nampa and Twin Falls.

item.title: I-84 East - Meridian Exits
item.description: Meridian exits on I-84 east. Approaching Ten Mile Road, ID-69, and ID-55 junction.

item.description: I-84 east at Exit 38 - BL-84/Garrity Blvd/Idaho Center Blvd. Use I-84 east for Meridian and Boies. This is the eastern end of the Nampa/Caldwell business loop. This interchange was recently rebuilt as part of the widening of I-84 between Nampa and Boise.

item.description: ID-55 south at I-84/US-30 junction (Exit 33). Turn right for I-84/US-30 East/ID-55 south to Boise. Turn left for I-84/US-30 west to Caldwell and Ontario (Oregon). Continue ahead for Midland Blvd. ID-55 joins I-84 east to Meridian.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 42
item.description: I-84 East at Exit 42 - Ten Mile Road. This is the newest interchange along I-84 in Idaho. It was completed in May of 2011.

item.title: I-84 East Approaching Exit 42
item.description: I-84 east approaching Exit 42 - Ten Mile Road.

item.title: US-30 East At US-95
item.description: US-30 East at US-95. Turn right for US-30 East/US-95 South; left for US-95 North. US-30 joins US-95 through Fruitland.

item.description: US-30 East approaching US-95. Turn left for US-95 North to Weiser and Payette. Turn right for US-95 South/US-30 East for Parma. US-30 joins US-95 South through Fruitland.

item.title: I-84 West - Exits 53 and 52
item.description: I-84 west at Exit 53 - Vista Ave./Boise Airport and approaching Exit 52 - Orchard St.

item.description: End BL-84 (Burley and Heyburn) at I-84 west and ID-24. Use I-84 west for Twin Falls and Boise. Use ID-24 for Rupert and Minidoka.

item.description: BL-84/US-30 east approaching I-84 and ID-24. US-30 turns east onto I-84 and the road continues as ID-24 towards Rupert.

item.description: Approaching BL-84/US-30 on ID-81 north in Burley.

item.description: ID-77 north at ID-81. Use ID-77 north for Rupert and I-84; ID-81 south to Malta; and ID-81 north to Burley.

item.description: ID-77 south at ID-81 in Declo.

item.title: ID-77 South Approaching ID-81
item.description: ID-77 south approaching ID-81 in Declo.

item.title: End I-86 West at I-84
item.description: End I-86 west at I-84. Merge right onto Exit 1 for I-84 East/Ogden/Salt Lake. Continue ahead for I-84/US-30 West/Twin Falls. This is the western end of I-86.

item.title: I-86 West at I-84
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 1 - I-84 East/Ogden/Salt Lake and I-84 West/US-30 West/Twin Falls. I-86 ends at I-84.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 56
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 56 - Pocatello Regional Airport.

item.title: I-86 West - Fort Hall Indian Reservation
item.description: Entering the Fort Hall Indian Reservation on I-86 west.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 58
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 58 - West Pocatello. US-30 joins I-86 here westbound.

item.title: I-86 West - Freeway Entrance
item.description: I-86 west onramp at Exit 61. The Freeway Entrance type sign assembly is not common in Idaho.

item.description: US-91 north at I-86 (Exit 61) onramp. Turn right on I-86 for Idaho Falls and Salt Lake. Continue over overpass for I-86 west to Twin Falls. US-91 continues north to Chubbuck.

item.description: US-91 south at I-86 east (To I-15). Use I-86 east for Idaho Falls and Salt Lake. Continue south on US-91 for Pocatello. I-86 east ends at I-15 just east of here.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61 Offramp at US-91
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 61 offramp, US-91 jct. Use US-91 north for Chubbuck. Use US-91 south for Pocatello. US-91 north is part of the Oregon/California Trail - Goodale Cutoff.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61
item.description: I-86 west at Exit 61 - US-91/Chubbuck.

item.title: I-86 West - Exit 61
item.description: I-86 West approaching Exit 61 - US-91/Chubbuck. This is the first exit westbound on I-86.

item.title: I-15 North at Exit 72
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 72 - I-86 West/Twin Falls/Chubbuck. Continue north on I-15 for Blackfoot and Idaho Falls. This is the last exit on I-15 north in the Pocatello area.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 72
item.description: Approaching Exit 72 - I-86 west to Twin Falls and Chubbuck on I-15 north. Continue north on I-15 for Blackfoot and Idaho Falls.

item.title: I-15 North - Exits 71 and 72
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 71 - Pocatello Creek Road. Approaching Exit 72 - I-86 West/Chubbuck/Twin Falls.

item.description: I-15 north approaching Exit 71 - Pocatello Creek Road.

item.title: I-15 North - Exits 69, 71, and 72
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 69 - Clark St. Approaching Exit 71 - Pocatello Creek Road, and Exit 72 - Junction I-86 West.

item.title: I-15 North - Exit 69
item.description: I-15 north approaching Exit 69 - Clark St./Idaho State University.

item.description: Frontage Road north at I-15/US-30/US-91 (Exit 67) north. Use I-15 north for Pocatello. Use Frontage Road north for Pocatello. Use Frontage Road south for Portneuf Area and Mink Creek Recreation Area.

item.description: US-30 west at ID-34 north to Wayan and Jackson. ID-34 joins US-30 west through Soda Springs towards McCammon and Pocatello.

item.title: US-30 West at ID-34
item.description: US-30 west at ID-34 in Soda Springs. Turn right on ID-34 north for Afton and Jackson (both in Wyoming). ID-34 joins US-30 west through Soda Springs. Continue west on US-30/ID-34 for McCammon and Pocatello. ID-34 is part of the Pioneer Historic Byway, which is why the shield is a brown color.

item.title: US-30 West - Entering Caribou County
item.description: Entering Caribou County on US-30 west.

item.title: US-30 West - Georgetown Summit
item.description: US-30 west at Gorgetown Summit - Elevation 6,283 Feet. Idaho Transportation Maintenance Yard in the background.

item.title: US-30 East - Oregon Trail/California Trail
item.description: US-30 east in Montpelier, with California and Oregon Trail Auto Tour Route signs.

item.title: US-30 West at US-89
item.description: US-30 west at US-89. Turn left for US-89 south to Paris. Continue ahead for US-30 West towards Soda Springs and Pocatello, and US-89 north.

item.title: US-30 West at US-89
item.description: US-30 west at US-89 in Montpelier. US-89 joins US-30 through Montpelier. The Oregon Trail-Bear Lake Scenic Byway joins US-30 here, from US-89 south. That is why the US-89 south and US-30 west shields are brown.

item.title: US-30 West - Distance Marker
item.description: First distance marker on US-30 west in Idaho. Distance to Montpelier, Soda Springs, and Pocatello.

item.title: Welcome To Idaho - US-30 West
item.description: Welcome to Idaho on US-30 west. Entering Bear Lake County. Taken at the Wyoming-Idaho Border.

item.title: ID-33 East - WY-22 Closure Information
item.description: Teton Pass road closure information on ID-33 east approaching the Wyoming state line. When Teton Pass is closed in Wyoming, this is where the road closure starts, just inside of Idaho. All traffic must return to Victor Idaho when the road closure lights are flashing. This is one of the few instances in Idaho of a state highway shield from another state located inside Idaho.

item.title: ID-33 East at ID-31
item.description: ID-33 East at ID-31 in Victor. Turn right on ID-31 south for Swan Valley. Continue ahead on ID-33 for Teton Village and Jackson (both in Wyoming). Teton Scenic Byway leaves ID-33 here and follows ID-31 south.

item.description: ID-33 east at ID-32 in Victor. The Teton Scenic Byway turns right here onto ID-31.

item.description: ID-33 east approaching ID-31. ID-31 between Victor and Swan Valley is a restricted route for trucking.

item.description: ID-33 East at ID-32 North. The Teton Scenic Byway joins ID-33 east here. The Teton Range is in the background of the photo.

Turn right on Old US-30 for I-84 east towards Hammett and Twin Falls. Continue on ID-51 north for I-84/BL-84 and Boise.

Oddly, there are two different control cities for two different sets of lanes. Through Nampa, all through traffic is urged to use the left lanes, so it does not make since why Ontario bound traffic use the left most lane.

item.title: US-91 - Red Rock Pass Historical Marker
item.description: Historical Marker on Red Rock Pass, US-91 South. All highways in Idaho have these historical markers. To see all of them check out the Idaho State Historical Marker Guide. Red Rock Pass is where ancient Lake Bonneville - an inland sea, which covered most of the great basin, overflowed into the Snake Plain. Evidence of this great flood is everywhere along the Snake and Columbia Rivers in the Pacific Northwest. This pass marks the divide between the Great Basin and the Snake/Columbia River drainages.
